cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving east across central Florida today then curving northeast and accelerating offshore of the east-central Florida coast and up the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Florida peninsula (near Tampa Bay area)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: 0 (system is already well east of Mobile’s coastal waters and will not approach)
cyclone.hours_of_strike: 0 (no direct strike expected at Mobile, AL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Anclote River to Englewood, FL (west-central Florida Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central and south Florida Gulf coast today, then east-central Florida Atlantic coast and portions of the southeast U.S. Atlantic seaboard
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: 2017-07-31 (system passes its farthest western point well east of Mobile the morning of 31 Jul)
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions possible; sustained tropical-storm-force winds not expected at Mobile
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Mobile Bay as system remains well to the east
weather_observation.rainfall: Little to no direct rainfall impact; scattered light showers possible on outer periphery
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential for elevated rip currents along Alabama Gulf beaches but no significant operational hazards at the port
